title: Justbillywitt
author: Justbillywitt
content: My people shey una see how the fuel subsidy removal has affected our economy. I keep asking my self what would have been the situation of the country economy if the president on his inaugural speech had said we are ending fuel subsidy and now we are using that same amount of money paid for subsidy and investing it on Bitcoin. And also made a bold declaration that the country has lifted all the ban placed on financial institutions facilitating cryptocurrency transactions and asked the central bank to unblock all accounts that has been blocked due to cryptocurrency transactions. I think this would have strengthened our Naira against the USD.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: With the way things are going with the fuel subsidy of a thing, everything is already turning to scam itself because the government are just playing on the people's intelligence, fuel subsidy or not, there's nothing to show forth at the cause, inflation is looming every aspects of the economy, there's nothing to point out for as a recent success through the fuel subsidy removal over the years, instead of things getting better, they are rather going more worst, my best advice for everyone is not to rely on the government or their fiat currency, hold your asset Investment in bitcoin and be independent.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Quote from: Justbillywitt on November 06, 2023, 11:31:59 AMMy people shey una see how the fuel subsidy removal has affected our economy. I keep asking my self what would have been the situation of the country economy if the president on his inaugural speech had said we are ending fuel subsidy and now we are using that same amount of money paid for subsidy and investing it on Bitcoin. And also made a bold declaration that the country has lifted all the ban placed on financial institutions facilitating cryptocurrency transactions and asked the central bank to unblock all accounts that has been blocked due to cryptocurrency transactions. I think this would have strengthened our Naira against the USD. They have lifted all bans placed on cryptocurrency and crypto related businesses. Nigeria is a crypto friendly country now even though Bitcoin have not been made a legal tender. On the issue of fuel subsidy removal, it will be difficult for the government to invest the money for subsidy on Bitcoin because most of those monies were borrowed, not that we had excess money in out treasury. You will agree with me that Nigerian government does not gave a culture of investment, most of the borrowed funds are injected into infrastructure and servicing of old debts. So, we can talk investment when we have a leader that understands the importance of saving for the next generation... only then can we expect diversification to Bitcoin and other profitable investment instruments.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: It look like our leaders are still playing games with Naija citizens destiny because, how can someone came out public and declared fuel subsidy removal for the benefits of our economy but the economy is getting worst everyday and is causing people to do any evils things just to survive in the country.  Now that many people are regretting for hailing the president for his inauguration speech because, they thought the man will rescue Nigeria the way he rescued Lagos state economy when he was a governor for 8 years, and he did well by making Lagos state the most highest state that has population of industries in the country.You know, there are many people in the country that hate decentralized currency which they will never support president to make some pronouncement to invest such amount of money in BTC because they will not have access to it to withdraw the coin the way they use to have access to fiat money by saying snake has swallow the millions or billions and get away with it easily.

Because no be small thing wey dem do by restricting crypto exchange for we country, the economy still dey struggle for ground. Shabi ona observe say as the CBN government don start to act by first removing FX restriction the currency con start to dey get value small small, so just imaging say as you talk am na so em come do am, our currency for don get chest to fit dey boost for where dollar dey. Though after naira get value for where dollar dey we for still dey suffer high price of fuel oo, but at least majority of some kind things price for come down.

comments.body: Quote from: Justbillywitt on November 06, 2023, 11:31:59 AMMy people shey una see how the fuel subsidy removal has affected our economy. I think this would have strengthened our Naira against the USD. That is going to be a very huge declaration if it was made in the day of the inaugural lecture. This cannot even be possible, how can you make declaration to invest public funds into bitcoin when they know nothing about it, it doesn’t make no sense and it will cause a lot of mayhem in the society if such is done. It is a good idea to we bitcoin enthusiasts, but do you think that other people that have say in the economy, I mean the house of assembly members can easily be convinced to allow this pass through when we complain everyday of them be corrupt leaders. Bitcoin is a very volatile currency and you can’t tell the next move of the currency. In a country that the economy situation is not stable, can this money be putting into an investment that will benefit the public in the long run and not immediately. There is a lot to consider before such is done, I just hope the fuel subsidy money removal will go a long way to help the citizens and make the country better for all in the long run.Quote from: Zanab247 on November 06, 2023, 03:13:21 PMIt look like our leaders are still playing games with Naija citizens destiny because, how can someone came out public and declared fuel subsidy removal for the benefits of our economy but the economy is getting worst everyday and is causing people to do any evils things just to survive in the country.  Now that many people are regretting for hailing the president for his inauguration speech because, they thought the man will rescue Nigeria the way he rescued Lagos state economy when he was a governor for 8 years, and he did well by making Lagos state the most highest state that has population of industries in the country.Expectations are too high which is not a good mindset to have when hoping for a change from a new government. Not all political promises will be fulfilled and we just have ti live by the little that is done. Those people going to do evil cannot be said they are doing it because of the economic crisis of the country. It is by their own will and we won’t blame the government for that. If everyone is feeling devastated by the economic situation, then everyone will become evil in the nation, does that makes sense to you? Change does not happen overnight and I hope and pray that we have a better country and good economy in the next four years. I haven’t lost hope yet because Rome was not built in a day, so Nigeria cannot get better overnight.Quote from: Zanab247 on November 06, 2023, 03:13:21 PMYou know, there are many people in the country that hate decentralized currency which they will never support president to make some pronouncement to invest such amount of money in BTC because they will not have access to it to withdraw the coin the way they use to have access to fiat money by saying snake has swallow the millions or billions and get away with it easily.If they really want to, it can be done even if it will take time to put things in place before finally pronouncing it. Public funds is not money for any political appointee, if the money for their office is already allocated to them, they shouldn’t be looking at what they will stand to get in the public funds already invested. Remember, any investment in bitcoin to reap a good profit has to be for a long term and not short, so they can’t be waiting forever for the money to have been profitable before they will do their work if funds are provided to them as well. Money invested in bitcoin are not money that should be needed soon, take example of El Salvador and see what investing public funds into bitcoin is all about.

Naija government no go fit make Bitcoin legal because if they do, they will not get much power over us because they know say most Naija citizens go dey save their money for Bitcoin and they will not get full control over us again. They dey fully aware of why Satoshi created Bitcoin and as our leaders no think good for us they don't want us to gain that freedom. Our leaders fit wake up one morning and tell us say the Bitcoin wey they used the fuel subsidy money buy say they done lost access to the bitcoin wallet or hackers done hack the Bitcoin.

comments.author: Promocodeudo
comments.body: OP, I appreciate you for putting up this piece l idea here for us to give our personal views, the truth must be told I don't think any country has ever used a fund formerly used for the payment to subsidize a product to invest in what their economic team has not briefed the president about, Bitcoin is a good investment no doubt, no country, for now, has ever used such huge some of the public fund to invest in bitcoin, even though Bitcoin becomes a legal tender today I don't the government will consider that as a better option, with what I know about this country, there is no restriction to Bitcoin, people do their transactions freely, if you walk through billboards you will see exchanges advertising themselves for you to trade with them if there is restriction will you see such stuff, Nigeria as a country always experience leader that is clueless, if you say investing in our refineries, rehabilitating them, making them work in full capacity, this will in the long run reduce the price of our petroleum products which practically controls the price of other commodities.
